title: Equality, sports, and Title IX - Erin Buzuvis and Kristine Newhall

multiple-choice.question: What law was passed by Congress in 1972 to protect girls and women from discrimination in schools, colleges, and universities?
What percentage of college athletes were women in 1972?
What are the two general categories used by the government to measure equality in sports under Title IX?

options.label: C
options.text: Equal funding, progress, and satisfied interests

options.label: D
options.text: Proportionality, equal funding, and satisfied interests

multiple-choice.question: What does the proportionality test require under Title IX?

options.label: A
options.text: Girls should receive the same number of athletic opportunities as boys

options.label: B
options.text: Girls should receive the same percentage of athletic opportunities as the percentage of girls in the student body

options.label: C
options.text: Girls should receive more athletic opportunities than boys

options.label: D
options.text: Girls should receive fewer athletic opportunities than boys

multiple-choice.question: What does the progress test require under Title IX?

options.label: A
options.text: Schools must make up for past inequalities by adding new sports for boys

options.label: B
options.text: Schools must make up for past inequalities by adding new sports for girls

options.label: C
options.text: Schools must provide equal funding for boys and girls sports

options.label: D
options.text: Schools must provide equal facilities for boys and girls sports

multiple-choice.question: What does the satisfied interests test require under Title IX?

options.label: A
options.text: Schools must regularly ask male students what sports they are interested in

options.label: B
options.text: Schools must regularly ask female students what sports they are interested in

options.label: C
options.text: Schools must provide equal funding for boys and girls sports

options.label: D
options.text: Schools must provide equal facilities for boys and girls sports

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the areas where Title IX requires equality between boys and girls teams?

options.label: A
options.text: Equipment and supplies, publicity, and scheduling of games

options.label: B
options.text: Equipment and supplies, publicity, scheduling of games, and practice times

options.label: C
options.text: Equipment and supplies, publicity, scheduling of games, practice times, and quality of coaches

options.label: D
options.text: Equipment and supplies, publicity, scheduling of games, practice times, quality of coaches, and medical services

multiple-choice.question: Who is responsible for making sure there is fairness in sports under Title IX?

options.label: C
options.text: Contact the Office of Civil Rights

options.label: D
options.text: Presenting someone else's work as one's own

options.text: Changing the sentence structure and idea order

options.label: C
options.text: Creating fake authors and book titles

options.text: Presenting someone else's work as one's own

options.label: C
options.text: Creating fake authors and book titles

options.label: D
options.text: Utilizing a thesaurus to substitute synonyms

multiple-choice.question: What is the technique of "revealing while concealing" in plagiarism?

options.label: B
options.text: Presenting someone else's work as one's own

options.label: C
options.text: Creating fake authors and book titles

multiple-choice.question: What is the best defense against plagiarism?

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.text: It was a suspicious erasure that implied a cover-up
